result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Pablo Morales was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Pablo Morales was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Pablo Morales was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to Attorney.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the officer unless it is for official business. 
Write a letter of apology to the officer. 
Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain a GED.
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. To be used at agent's discretion. Agent to determine whether or not to impose with or without non-working hours.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Pablo  Morales in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea as to counts 2, 3 and 5. Counts 1 and 4 are dismissed and read-in. Count 6 is dismissed outright. Court imposed the following sentence:

   The defendant was sentenced to the following:  COUNT 2

HUBER:  45 days, released for employment and school only (Credit - 11 days). Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. on October 26, 2015. May transfer to Kenosha County. Must report to Waukesha County first. 

FINE: $1192.00  

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $14.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

D/L REVOCATION: 18 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK:18 months;

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  11/18/2015. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

 Apply any bail that is posted


COUNT 3:  5 MONTHS HUBER CONSECUTIVE STAYED
COUNT 5:  3 MONTHS HUBER CONSECUTIVE STAYED

and placed on probation for 2 years

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling and get GED
*No contact with:  the officer unless its for official business
*letter of apolyogy to the officer
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 60 days jail, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Apply any bail that is posted and refund the balance of attorney Cotton's office.
